resources.string: Developer by: James Willian da Mata

Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR) is the minimum amount of energy your body needs to function at rest, that is, the energy spent to maintain vital functions such as breathing, blood circulation, body temperature and cellular activity.

To define the Daily Caloric Consumption, a calculation is made based on the BMR.\n
Gain weight: It is estimated to consume 40% more calories than you expend (calorie surplus).\n
Hypertrophy: It is estimated to consume 20% more calories than you expend, focusing on proteins and strength training.\n
Lose weight: It is estimated to expend 20% more calories than you consume (calorie deficit).
